rules.name: Double article
rules.message: Avoid using two articles in a row.

rules.name: Article before vowel
rules.message: Use 'an' before words that start with vowels.

rules.name: Unnecessary article with uncountable nouns
rules.message: Do not use 'the' with uncountable nouns.

rules.name: Third person singular verb
rules.message: Add -s to verbs with he/she/it (e.g., he goes).

rules.name: Past simple after did
rules.message: After 'did', use the base verb (e.g., did go, not did went).

rules.name: Wrong continuous tense
rules.message: Use -ing form after 'is/was' for continuous tenses (e.g., is going).

rules.name: Future tense double will
rules.message: Do not repeat 'will'. Use only once.

rules.name: Going to + past verb
rules.message: After 'going to', use the base verb (e.g., going to play).

rules.name: Present perfect with past time
rules.message: Do not use present perfect with past time expressions. Use past simple.

rules.name: Continuous with stative verbs
rules.message: Do not use stative verbs in continuous form (e.g., I know, not I am knowing).

rules.name: Plural nouns after quantifiers
rules.message: Nouns after 'many/several/few' should usually be plural.

rules.name: Unnecessary plural with uncountables
rules.message: Uncountable nouns should not be plural.

rules.name: Double negative
rules.message: Avoid double negatives in English.

rules.name: Confusion its/it's
rules.message: 'Its' = possessive, 'it's' = it is.

rules.name: Wrong comparative
rules.message: Do not use 'more' with comparatives (e.g., say better, not more better).

rules.name: Superlative form
rules.message: Do not use 'most' with superlatives (say 'the best').

rules.name: Preposition mistake
rules.message: Check prepositions: discuss (no about), married to, depend on.

rules.name: Modal verb + to
rules.message: Do not use 'to' after modal verbs.

rules.name: Wrong passive form
rules.message: Passive uses past participle (e.g., is written), not -ing.

rules.name: There is with plurals
rules.message: Use 'there are' with plural nouns.

rules.name: Much with countables
rules.message: Use 'many' with plural countable nouns.

rules.name: Few/many with uncountables
rules.message: Use 'little/much' with uncountable nouns.
